DataElement.preferredName: Self-Report COVID-19 Infection Symptom Dizziness Heart Rate And Blood Pressure Confirmation Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Verification of dizziness by changes in heart rate and blood pressure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Self-Report COVID-19 Infection Symptom Dizziness Heart Rate And Blood Pressure Confirmation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation of an event or information._An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._A sensation of lightheadedness, unsteadiness, turning, spinning or rocking._The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The pressure of the circulating blood against the walls of the blood vessels._Having been established or verified.

Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:A sensation of lightheadedness, unsteadiness, turning, spinning or rocking.

Concepts.definition: An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation of an event or information.

An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A sensation of lightheadedness, unsteadiness, turning, spinning or rocking.

Property.preferredName: Heart Rate And Blood Pressure Confirmation
Property.preferredDefinition: The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The pressure of the circulating blood against the walls of the blood vessels.:Having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The pressure of the circulating blood against the walls of the blood vessels.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
